patisiran_ttr_guide.notes: FDA-approved guide strand sequence from Patisiran (Onpattro). First FDA-approved RNAi therapeutic (2018).

patisiran_ttr_passenger.notes: Passenger strand complementary to guide. Designed to be preferentially degraded.

clinical_data.efficacy: Significant reduction in serum TTR levels
clinical_data.safety: Generally well tolerated with manageable infusion-related reactions
clinical_data.dosing: 0.3 mg/kg every 3 weeks via IV infusion

modification_rationale.guide_pattern: Strategic 2'-O-methyl modifications at positions 1,4,6,11,13,16,19 provide optimal balance of stability and RISC loading efficiency
modification_rationale.passenger_pattern: Limited modifications on passenger strand reduce its activity and promote degradation
modification_rationale.overhang: dTdT DNA overhangs provide nuclease resistance and are compatible with LNP delivery
modification_rationale.overall_strategy: Pattern optimized through extensive medicinal chemistry to achieve therapeutic efficacy with acceptable safety profile

references.title: An RNAi therapeutic targeting transthyretin in hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis
Methods and compositions for treating transthyretin (TTR) related ocular amyloidosis

notes: First FDA-approved RNAi therapeutic - landmark achievement
Modification pattern validated in clinical trials
Pattern can serve as template for other liver-targeted siRNAs
Requires specialized LNP delivery system for in vivo efficacy
